1.verse: Introduction -Chapter 1 -Address. -Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all the saints in Christ Jesus at Philippi, together with their bishops and deacons:

2.verse: grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: Joyful Prayer for the Philippians. -I give thanks to my God every time I think of you.

4.verse: I always pray for you, interceding for you with joy

5.verse: because of your sharing in the gospel from the first day until now.

6.verse: I am confident of this: that the one who began a good work in you will bring it to completion on the day of Christ Jesus.

7.verse: It is only right for me to feel this way toward you, because I hold you in my heart, for you have all shared with me in God’s grace, both during my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel.

8.verse: Indeed, God is my witness how I long for all of you with the affection of Christ Jesus.

9.verse: And for this I pray: that your love may increase ever more and more in knowledge and full insight

10.verse: to enable you to discover what is really important, so that on the day of Christ you may be pure and blameless,

11.verse: filled with the fruits of righteousness that comes through Jesus Christ for the glory and praise of God.

12.verse: News and Instructions -To Live Is Christ. -Brethren, I want you to know that what has happened to me has actually helped spread the gospel,

13.verse: for my imprisonment has become known not only throughout the praetorium but to everyone else as well.

14.verse: And the majority of the brethren having taken encouragement in the Lord from my imprisonment, dare more than ever to proclaim the word without fear.

15.verse: It is true that some are proclaiming Christ out of envy and rivalry, but others are doing so with goodwill.

16.verse: These latter ones do so out of love, aware that I have been put here for the defense of the gospel.

17.verse: The former proclaim Christ out of selfish ambition, not in sincerity, but in an effort to increase my suffering while I am in chains.

18.verse: But what does it matter, as long as in every way, with false motives or true, that Christ is proclaimed? And in that I rejoice.Yes, and I will continue to rejoice,

19.verse: for I know that through your prayers and with the help of the Spirit of Jesus Christ this will result in deliverance for me.

20.verse: It is my firm expectation and hope that I will not be put to shame in any way, but will act with complete fearlessness, now as always, so that Christ will be exalted in my body, whether by my life or by my death.

21.verse: For to me, to live is Christ and to die is gain.

22.verse: But if I continue living in the body, that will mean fruitful work for me. Hence, I do not know which I should choose.

23.verse: I am pulled in opposite directions. My desire is to depart and to be with Christ, for that is far better,

24.verse: but, it is a more urgent need for you that I remain in the body.

25.verse: Since I am convinced of this, I know that I shall remain and continue with all of you to ensure your progress and joy in the faith.

26.verse: Thus, you will rebound with joy in Christ Jesus when I return to be with you once again.

27.verse: Striving and Suffering for Christ. -Only live in a manner worthy of the gospel of Christ. Then, whether I come and see you or simply hear news of you from a distance, I will know that you are standing firm and united in spirit, striving together for the faith of the gospel,

28.verse: and being in no way intimidated by those who oppose you.This will be a clear sign to them of their forthcoming destruction as well as of your salvation. All of this is in accord with God’s design.

29.verse: For it has been granted you not only to believe in Christ but also to suffer for him.

30.verse: You are taking part in the same struggle that you have seen in me and that you now hear I am experiencing.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Unity and Humility. -Therefore, if there is any consolation in Christ, any comfort in love, any fellowship in the Spirit, any compassion and sympathy,

2.verse: make my joy complete by being of the same mind, having the same love for one another, and united in thought.

3.verse: Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vanity, but humbly regard others as better than yourselves.

4.verse: Be concerned not only with your own interests but also with those of others.

5.verse: Let your attitude be identical to that of Christ Jesus.

6.verse: The Humbled and Exalted Christ -Though he was in the form of God,he did not regard equality with Godas something to be grasped.

7.verse: Rather, he emptied himself,taking the form of a slave,being born in human likeness.Being found in appearance as a man,

8.verse: he humbled himself,and became obedient to death,even death on a cross.

9.verse: Because of this, God greatly exalted himand bestowed on him the namethat is above all other names,

10.verse: so that at the name of Jesusevery knee should bendof those in heaven and on earth and under the earth,

11.verse: and every tongue should proclaimto the glory of God the Father:Jesus Christ is Lord.

12.verse: Innocence of the Children of God. -Therefore, my beloved, just as you have always been obedient when I am present, you must be so all the more now when I am absent, as you work out your salvation in fear and trembling.

13.verse: For it is God who is at work in you, enabling you both to desire and to act for his chosen purpose.

14.verse: Do everything without grumbling or arguing,

15.verse: so that you may show yourselves blameless and beyond reproach, children of God without spot in the midst of an evil and depraved generation, among which you shine like lights in the world

16.verse: as you hold fast tenaciously to the word of life. Then I will have cause to boast of you on the day of Christ that I did not run in vain or labor to no purpose.

17.verse: But even if my blood is to be poured out as a libation upon the sacrifice and the offering of your faith, I rejoice, and I share my joy with all of you.

18.verse: In the same way, you too must rejoice and share your joy with me.

19.verse: Timothy Commended. -I hope, in the Lord Jesus, to send Timothy to you soon, so that I may be cheered by hearing news of you.

20.verse: I have no one else like him in his genuine concern for your welfare.

21.verse: All the others serve their own interests more than those of Jesus Christ.

22.verse: His reputation is well known to you. Like a son helping his father, he has worked with me in the service of the gospel.

23.verse: I hope to send him to you as soon as I see how things will go with me.

24.verse: And I am confident in the Lord that I myself shall also come before long.

25.verse: Epaphroditus Praised. -I have also decided that it is necessary to send you Epaphroditus, my brother and coworker and fellow soldier, who was your messenger and ministered to my needs.

26.verse: He has missed all of you and been greatly distressed because you heard that he was ill.

27.verse: And indeed he was dangerously ill and close to death. However, God had mercy on him—and not merely on him but on me as well, so that I would not have to endure one sorrow on top of another.

28.verse: Therefore, I am all the more eager to send him in order that you may rejoice on seeing him again and I may thereby feel less anonymous.

29.verse: Receive him joyfully in the Lord, and value people like him very highly.

30.verse: For he came perilously close to death for the work of Christ, risking his life to render me those services that you were unable to provide.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord.Warning against False Teachers -Worship by the Spirit. - I do not mind writing the same things to you again; it is for your safety.

2.verse: Beware of the dogs! Beware of evil-doers! Beware of those who mutilate the flesh!

3.verse: For we are the circumcision, we who worship by the Spirit of God and who boast in Christ Jesus and do not place any confidence in the flesh—

4.verse: even though I too have reason for confidence in the flesh.Joyous Sacrifice of All Things for Christ. - If anyone thinks that he has reasons to be confident in the flesh, I have more!

5.verse: I was circumcised on the eighth day of my life. I was one of the people of Israel, the tribe of Benjamin. I am a Hebrew and the son of Hebrews. In regard to the Law, I was a Pharisee;

6.verse: in regard to religious zeal, I was a persecutor of the Church; in regard to righteousness under the Law, I was without fault.

7.verse: All these I once regarded as assets, but now I have come to regard them as losses because of Christ.

8.verse: Even more than that, I count everything as loss because of the supreme good of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. For his sake, I have suffered the loss of all other things, and I regard them as so much rubbish, in order that I may gain Christ

9.verse: and be found in him.I do not wish to have any righteousness of my own based on the Law, but one that comes through faith in Christ, the righteousness given by God in response to faith.

10.verse: All I want is to come to know Christ and the power of his resurrection and to share in his sufferings by becoming conformed to his death,

11.verse: so that I may attain the resurrection from the dead.

12.verse: Racing toward the Goal. -It is not that I have already attained this or have yet reached perfection. But I press on to take hold of that for which Christ once took hold of me.

13.verse: Brethren, I do not claim to have taken hold of it as yet. Only this one thing: forgetting what is behind and straining forward to what lies ahead,

14.verse: I press on toward the finishing line to win the heavenly prize to which God has called me in Christ Jesus.

15.verse: Those of us who are mature should adopt this same attitude. If on any matter you have a different point of view, this too God will make clear to you.

16.verse: Only let us hold fast in our conduct to what we have already attained.

17.verse: Our Citizenship Is in Heaven. -Brethren, join in imitating me, and take note of those who conduct themselves in accord with the model you have in us.

18.verse: As I have told you before, and now remind you with tears, many live as enemies of the cross of Christ.

19.verse: Their end is destruction. Their god is their stomach. Their glory is in their shame. Their minds are set on earthly things.

20.verse: But our citizenship is in heaven, and from there we await our Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ.

21.verse: He will transform our lowly bodies so that they will be conformed to his glorified body by the power that also enables him to make all things subject to himself.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -Therefore, my brethren, whom I love and for whom I long, my joy and crown: stand firm in the Lord, beloved.

2.verse: Counsels and Thanksgiving -Christian Concord. -I exhort both Euodia and Syntyche to come to a mutual understanding in the Lord.

3.verse: I also ask you, my loyal companion Syzygus, to help these women, for they have struggled alongside me in the work of the gospel, together with Clement and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the book of life.

4.verse: Rejoice without Ceasing. -Rejoice in the Lord always. Again I say: Rejoice!

5.verse: Let your kindness be known to everyone. The Lord is near.

6.verse: Do not worry about anything, but present your needs to God in prayer and petition, with thanksgiving.

7.verse: Then the peace of God, which is beyond all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

8.verse: All That Is Truly Human Is Christian. -Finally, brethren, let your minds be filled with whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is pleasing, whatever is commendable, whatever is excellent, whatever is worthy of praise.

9.verse: Do the things that you have learned, received, and heard from me and that you saw me doing. Then the God of peace will be with you.

10.verse: Acknowledgment of the Community’s Gift -Contentment in Any Circumstances. -I rejoice greatly in the Lord that now at last you have renewed your concern for me. You were, of course, concerned about me, but you had no opportunity to show it.

11.verse: I do not say this because I have been in need, for I have learned to be content with whatever I have.

12.verse: I know how to live with little, and I know how to live with plenty. In any and all circumstances, I have learned the secret of being well fed and of going hungry, of having plenty and of being in need.

13.verse: I can do all things in him who strengthens me.

14.verse: Philippian Generosity. -Even so, it was kind of you to share my difficulties.

15.verse: You Philippians are aware that in the early days of the gospel when I set out from Macedonia, not a single Church other than yours shared with me in giving and receiving.

16.verse: Even when I was in Thessalonica, you sent me something for my needs on more than one occasion.

17.verse: Do not think that it is the gift that I value most. What I desire is for the interest to mount up in your account.

18.verse: I have been paid in full and have more than enough. I am satisfied now that I have received from Epaphroditus the gifts you sent. They are a fragrant offering, an acceptable sacrifice pleasing to God.

19.verse: And my God will fully supply all your needs out of the riches of his glory in Christ Jesus.

20.verse: Doxology. -To our God and Father be glory forever and ever. Amen.

21.verse: Conclusion -Final Greetings. -Give my greetings to every one of the saints in Christ Jesus. The brethren who are with me send their greetings to you,

22.verse: as do all the saints here, especially those in the emperor’s service.

23.verse: Benediction. -The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
